value.title: The Rebranding of ‘Trump Country’
value.excerpt: The population is fleeing, jobs are disappearing and coal really isn’t coming back. West Virginia’s boldest plan to reverse the slide is bribing white-collar workers to move from out of state.

value.title: White House helped form ethics agreement with art gallery that's selling Hunter Biden's paintings, sources say
value.excerpt: Hunter Biden's artistic debut is sparking ethics concerns for the White House as some critics raise eyebrows over the high-priced pieces and whether they pose a conflict of interest.

value.title: Biden to speak on Afghanistan amid US troop withdrawal and Taliban gains
value.excerpt: President Joe Biden will receive an update Thursday on the swiftly concluding war in Afghanistan, where a near-complete withdrawal of American troops is coinciding with major Taliban gains.

value.title: Mark Zuckerberg and Sheryl Sandberg’s Partnership Did Not Survive Trump
value.excerpt: The company they built is wildly successful. But her Washington wisdom didn’t hold up, and neither did their close working relationship.

value.title: Lobsters, cruises and scotch: One Cabinet secretary's push to sell Biden's agenda
value.excerpt: Commerce Secretary Gina Raimondo won't hesitate to make the hard ask. She wants to make that clear.

value.title: Trump-allied lawmaker floats Pennsylvania audit plan that Democrats slam as political ploy
value.excerpt: Audit fever is catching on as a Republican lawmaker in Pennsylvania announced Wednesday that he is pushing for a so-called forensic audit of the 2020 election.

value.title: Trump allegedly praised Hitler as doing 'a lot of good things' new book claims
value.excerpt: Then-President Donald Trump allegedly praised Adolf Hitler during a discussion with his White House chief of staff John Kelly in 2018 while on a trip to Paris to commemorate the armistice after World War I, according to excerpts of an upcoming book, obtained by CNN, from Wall Street Journal reporter

value.title: First on CNN: Biden administration ramps up investment in environmental justice
value.excerpt: The Environmental Protection Agency announced Wednesday an additional $50 million in funding to enhance air pollution monitoring and improve air quality in low-income communities and communities of color.

value.title: Trump announces a lawsuit against tech firms for censoring him, and fund-raises off it.
value.excerpt: Speaking about “freedom of speech” and the First Amendment — which applies to the government, not private-sector companies — Mr. Trump called his lawsuit a “very beautiful development.”

value.title: Haitian president assassinated, Biden calls attack 'very worrisome'
value.excerpt: President Joe Biden called the assassination of Haitian President Jovenel Moïse "very worrisome" after an armed group entered his home, killing him and injuring the country's first lady.

value.title: Trump says he'll sue Facebook, Google and Twitter. It's a familiar threat
value.excerpt: Former President Donald Trump on Wednesday filed class-action lawsuits targeting Facebook and its CEO Mark Zuckerberg and Twitter and its CEO Jack Dorsey in a Hail Mary move after being removed from their platforms. Trump also filed a class-action suit against YouTube, which names Sundar Pichai, the

value.title: Marjorie Taylor Greene compares Biden vaccine push to Nazi-era 'brown shirts' weeks after apologizing for Holocaust comments
value.excerpt: Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene on Tuesday compared officials carrying out President Joe Biden's latest Covid-19 vaccination push to Nazi-era "brown shirts," just weeks after apologizing for her comments comparing Capitol Hill mask-wearing rules to the Holocaust.

value.title: DIEHL dials it down on TRUMP — JOCKEYING BEGINS over FED AID — UNPACKING Boston mayoral FUNDRAISING
value.excerpt: Geoff Diehl co-chaired Donald Trump’s campaign here in 2016 and just months ago called on GOP Gov. Charlie Baker to “retract” his support for the president’s second impeachment. But now that he’s running for governor,

value.title: Biden and Harris to focus on voting rights Thursday, expand DNC program
value.excerpt: President Joe Biden and Vice President Kamala Harris will hold separate events Thursday to focus attention on Democratic efforts to combat voter suppression and protect voting rights nationwide, Democratic officials tell CNN.

value.title: The Point: Donald Trump is still the king of the GOP -- J.D. Vance just proved why
value.excerpt: It took J.D. Vance only four days to understand just how much control Donald Trump has over the Republican Party these days.

value.title: How much money could Biden raise for infrastructure through tougher IRS enforcement? It's not clear
value.excerpt: President Joe Biden wants to raise money for his ambitious economic agenda by ramping up enforcement at the Internal Revenue Service -- a way for the federal government to spend more money without raising taxes or adding to the deficit, making it a win-win in the eyes of lawmakers.

value.title: Even with our 'darkest days' gone, Biden can't declare full independence from virus
value.excerpt: President Joe Biden conjured a vision of Americans coming back together and reclaiming their freedom from the worst ravages of the pandemic as a nation long silenced by sickness and death exploded back to life on the Fourth of July.

value.title: Clyburn doesn't want a former president testifying before select committee but says Trump should 'if it comes to that'
value.excerpt: House Majority Whip Jim Clyburn said Sunday he doesn't want to see a former president testify before the House select committee investigating the January 6 insurrection but that Donald Trump should do so "if it comes to that."

value.title: Trump rails against ‘prosecutorial misconduct’ during Florida rally
value.excerpt: The former president brought a MAGA-style rally to Sarasota, where he derided the indictments as "prosecutorial misconduct."

value.title: Biden on Sha'Carri Richardson's suspension for positive drug test: 'The rules are the rules'
value.excerpt: President Joe Biden said he was "really proud of the way" US track and field star Sha'Carri Richardson responded following a positive drug test and subsequent suspension that will prevent her from running in her signature event for Team USA in the Olympics later this month, but that "everybody knows

value.title: Arizona Republic: Trump allies pressured Maricopa County election supervisors
value.excerpt: In the weeks following the 2020 election, former President Donald Trump's White House attempted to call the chair of the Maricopa County Board of Supervisors — a key county in the state Trump lost by a small margin to then-candidate Joe Biden — according to a new report from the Arizona Republic published

value.title: Biden announces pick for US ambassador to Germany
value.excerpt: President Joe Biden announced his pick for US ambassador to Germany on Friday, moving to fill a key diplomatic posting to one of the United States' closest allies.

value.title: Supreme Court upheld Trump's 'Big Lie' in Ariz. voting laws ruling, Latino group says
value.excerpt: The Latino civil rights group MALDEF said the Supreme Court's decision upholding Arizona voting restrictions accepted the false narrative of voter fraud.

value.title: White House goes into damage control mode after reports of dysfunction in Kamala Harris' office
value.excerpt: The White House dove into damage control this week after reports of dysfunction and infighting in Vice President Kamala Harris' office, with the administration trying to stop a drama-filled narrative from taking hold, according to five people who spoke to CNN about the dynamics within Harris' office.

value.title: 'This is historic progress:' Biden touts economic recovery after US added 850,000 jobs
value.excerpt: President Joe Biden on Friday touted America's economic recovery from the coronavirus pandemic after the US added 850,000 jobs in June.

value.title: Trump rolls out his defense for all seasons: It's all politics
value.excerpt: No matter the charge, the defense is the same: Donald Trump is the victim of a vicious political vendetta.

value.title: Trump Organization, Voting Rights, Cloud Gaming: Your Thursday Evening Briefing
value.excerpt: The Trump Organization and its C.F.O. were charged with fraud and tax crimes. The real estate business that catapulted Donald Trump to tabloid fame, television riches and ultimately the White House was charged with criminal tax fraud,

value.title: See Michael Cohen's reaction to Trump Organization charges
value.excerpt: New York prosecutors charged the Trump Organization, the Trump Payroll Corporation and Chief Financial Officer Allen Weisselberg in connection with an alleged tax scheme stretching back to 2005, in an extraordinary legal development against the former President's namesake company. Weisselberg, the Trump

value.title: Presidential historian: Trump should not be happy with this
value.excerpt: CNN presidential historian Tim Naftali analyzes a C-SPAN poll that ranks former President Donald Trump as the worst living President.

value.title: Trump visits the South Texas border amid a shift in the region toward Republicans
value.excerpt: Former President Donald Trump still wants a wall on the southern border. And he said it's Democrats' fault it hasn't happened yet.
